author: Henry Brean Arizona Daily Star
title: Video of car-top coyote in Tucson goes viral
text: The call of a Tucson coyote is echoing around the globe, thanks to a viral video of the animal howling from on top of a car at a Ford dealership. Patrick Irish Sr. had just started his 5 a.m. shift as a private security guard at the Tucson Auto Mall when he spotted the coyote perched on the roof of a brand new, all-electric Mustang at Holmes Tuttle Ford. Irish often hears the animals calling to each other and even sees them occasionally running through the car lots near the Rillito River, but this was a first. He said the scene almost seemed staged, with the coyote positioned directly under a street light and turned sideways to him in perfect profile. “It looked like a Halloween decoration,” Irish said. Irish shot his video of the car-lot coyote back on Oct. 22, but he didn’t share it on Facebook until Christmas Eve. He is not supposed to have his cell phone out while he’s on the job, but he couldn’t resist just this once. After a few seconds of filming, he walked toward the coyote and told it, “‘Hey, you gotta go,’” he said. “It was a good-sized, healthy looking thing. I didn’t want the rest of the family showing up.” The animal jumped down from the Mustang and took off “as soon as we made eye contact,” Irish said. It’s hard to know what the coyote was howling about. It might just have been bragging, though probably not about the great deal it just got on a new car, said [Shawnee Riplog-Peterson](https://tucson.com/news/local/environment/fox-recorded-stealing-trail-cameras-tucson-marana/article_03d4d884-92f2-11ee-9f36-179793c7a839.html), long-time curator of mammalogy and ornithology for the [Arizona-Sonora Desert Museum](https://www.desertmuseum.org). “I think a lot of it is territorial, and by being up high on something, the message will carry farther, which is good for them,” she said. “They’re big on territory.” Coyotes make up to [a dozen different calls](https://tucson.com/news/local/golf-course-coyotes-howl-at-sunset-in-northwest-tucson/video_3719108f-37f5-5fcc-899f-58811b7e46a8.html) — from yips and barks to long, lonesome howls — and even the experts aren’t sure what all of them mean, Riplog-Peterson said. “Some people call them song dogs because they have so many vocalizations.” The coyotes at the Desert Museum exhibit similar behavior to this one filmed at the Auto Mall, climbing up on two tall rocks in their enclosure to “check out the territory and see who’s coming their way,” she said. When Riplog-Peterson showed the video to her fellow staff members, one of the veterinarians immediately referenced the famous “Everything the light touches is our kingdom” scene from “The Lion King.” Coyotes have dramatically expanded their kingdom over the past two centuries. The opportunistic omnivore’s range now covers all of North America, and it has adapted to live off the spoils of human civilization — namely our garbage, the fruit from our trees and occasionally our pets. “They will seek out everything, because they can live off anything,” Riplog-Peterson said. “They’ve really become city slickers. They do just as good in urban areas as they do in rural areas.” The six-second clip really took off after [KOLD News 13 anchor Mary Coleman](https://x.com/Mary_reports/status/1740887803016405222?s=20) got Irish’s permission to post it on X, the social media site formerly known as Twitter. Since then, the footage has been viewed more than 10 million times on X alone and [picked up by USA Today](https://ftw.usatoday.com/2023/12/watch-coyote-howls-into-night-car-rooftop-tucson) and other media outlets. Irish began to suspect something was up when he went to show the video to a coworker and she told him she had already seen it on TikTok. “But I didn’t realize it (went viral) until my boy told me,” said the retired Air Force master sergeant, who has lived in Tucson for the past 25 years. Now if you Google “coyote howls on car,” the video of the Auto Mall serenade is the first thing that pops up. “It’s all over the place,” Irish said. Contact reporter Henry Brean at . On Twitter: [@RefriedBrean](https://twitter.com/RefriedBrean)

author: tremolantepenacho
title: #37 Al menos 15 intoxicados por un brote de salmonelosis tras comer una de las mejores hamburguesas de Madrid
text:
[xocolatl](/user/xocolatl)a [cadenaser.com](/go/link/3967271) [#1](c1#c-1) Pero lo más alucinante, al menos para mi, es la lista de espera: 35 días hay que esperar, desde que se reserva mesa (supongo que la cosa irá así) hasta que te atienden, 35 días por una jodida hamburguesa.
[#1](c1#c-1) De Madrid, al cielo.
Casa Dani cierra temporalmente por sospecha de intoxicación alimentaria
Me descojono un poco porque en el artículo que enlazan sobre cómo se hace, que es uno publicitario, te cuentan que "el beicon lo sirve en forma de salsa, integrado en una especie de mahonesa tuneada —"intensa y deliciosa"— de la que no quiere dar más detalles."
Bueno, ya sabemos los ingredientes secretos.
[#24](c24#c-24) "Cuando la carne se somete al proceso de picado, aumenta la exposición a bacterias dañinas como E.coli, salmonella y listeria, cuya capacidad de multiplicarse crece de forma significativa porque se incrementa también la superficie susceptible de contaminarse."
https://www.infobae.com/tendencias/2021/03/05/claves-para-evitar-intoxicaciones-alimentarias-con-carne-picada/
Y claro, un comunicado del propio establecimiento implicado seguro que es súper fiable.
Y por cierto, te devuelvo el negativo que se te ha caído.
Y una lista de espera de 35 días para los clientes que querían la foto de la experiencia y que cogieron cita con la salmonela. Quiero ver esas fotos. Y comentarios de "uy, qué envidia me das." Que para eso van.
Brote de salmonela en Madrid. Inmediatamente menéame:
-JAJJAJAJ tomad libertad
-Ayusooooo
-No era la mejor hamburguesería??? Pues toma!! todos muertos! Por... madrileños!!!
-lolololo
Puta mierda de comunidad esta, en serio.
[#31](c31#c-31) Es lo que tiene. Tantos años de hacer madrileñadas, al final la gente hace chanza cuando les sale el tiro por la culata en lo que sea...
[#0](c0#c-0) la entradilla es desafortunada más que un calvario se convirtió en un aprieto porque los comensales se fueron a escape libre.
Lo cierto es que con estos calores es facilisimo que esto ocurra, paree mentira que en 2024 no hayamos sido capaces de desarrollar ningun tipo e vacuna efectiva contra la salmonella o metodos de control mas eficientes en las cocinas y la restauracion. Me da pena.
[#8](c8#c-8) ¿Pena? ¿Por qué? Disponen de los mejores hospitales de colaboración público-privada donde ser atendidos, si es que su seguro se lo cubre.
Por cierto, una duda de alguien que sepa de seguridad alimentaria. No sería posible algun tipo de esterilizacion previa bien por meter a altas prsiones o algo de la comida asi en general? En plan de meter la hamburguesa a muy altas presiones que reviente todas las bacterias como se hace con el anisakis, antes de servir?
[#9](c9#c-9) No, no es posible... no sin alterar gravemente el sabor, textura, consistencia etc. de la comida.

author: Mark Torregrossa | mtorregr@mlive.com
title: Heavy downpours tonight and Friday with one Michigan area targeted for up to 5 inches of rain - mlive.com
text: We have a delicate weather situation over southern Michigan tonight and Friday. Slow moving thunderstorms with copious moisture to tap into could bring some very heavy rains. This heavy rain situation I’m talking about isn’t going to flood everyone. We can use Wisconsin right now as an example of what should be over southern Lower Michigan late tonight and Friday. Wisconsin has had very heavy rainfall in patches of thunderstorms today. Currently this evening there are three flash flood warnings in central Wisconsin due to rain amounts of two to five inches in a short time. Here is the always updated radar. The area of thunderstorms in Wisconsin is going to drift southeast into southwest Michigan tonight and then east into the Ann Arbor area and Detroit area tonight and Friday. Remember this won’t be a rain that all of us get into. It will be a rain that has some pockets of very heavy rainfall. If the heavy rain falls on poor draining intersections of southern Michigan you could have flooded roads. The radar forecast shows patches of heavy rain in thunderstorms somewhere in southern and southeastern Michigan overnight. I’m letting you know some abnormal heavy rain is possible. If you have a building project that would be affected by heavy rain do whatever you need to protect your project. Your drive to work Friday morning could be affected in southern and southeastern Michigan. Here is the rainfall forecast from a model that seems to be doing a good job with this situation. The red areas you see could have spotty three to five inch rains. Again this won’t be everywhere. We also don’t know exactly where the heaviest rain will be, but some of us will have a lot of rain in our rain gauge by this time Friday. The heaviest rain seems most likely from the Lansing area to Ann Arbor area to the Detroit area. So don’t be surprise by very heavy rain. Also know the humidity will be very high after these rains. We are in a tropical air environment right now. This is the type of weather some Michiganders wish for in January.
